The Consensus layer 

A public data structure that provides:

  • Persistence: once added, data can never be removed
  • Consensus: all honest participants have the same data 
  • Liveness: honest participants can add new transactions 
  • Openness: anyone can participate

‍

State machine replication vs. Open consensus

State machine replication can be seen as a way for all the servers and systems that a bank has to always recognise the same consistent information across all servers. Every step is authorised. Open consensus: anyone can add new data to the blockchain without authorisation. 


How are blocks added to the chain?

The participants send their secret key (which signifies ownership) with a signed transaction to miners.The consensus protocol randomly chooses a leader among the miners, who then orders the transaction into a block.The block is added to the blockchain, the leader gets paid the native blockchain currency, and the other miners make sure that the block is valid.

‍

A problem to be solved in blockchain

How do we make sure that no single miner has the power to order transactions? Miners can pretend to be thousands of miners, meaning they get elected as the leader every time. This is called a Sybil Attack. Proof of work, proof of stake, and proof of space are concepts to solve consensus problems.

The world of Cryptographic Primitives

  • Digital signatures + aggregation 

Digital signatures need to be a function of the data being signed, and the signature depends on the data. The signature, the public key and data go into the verifier algorithm, which decides if the digital signature is approved.

If someone does not have the signing key they cannot sign on your behalf. Digital signatures  are used everywhere: governance votes, consensus protocol votes and transaction  authorisations. All miners have to agree that the signature is valid.

BLS Signature aggregation: a compression mechanism to compress multiple signatures into one to not store all signatures on the blockchain. Check out Chia.

Merkle commitments 

  • A cryptographic commitment allows you to put data into an “envelope” and send it to an auctioneer who can open the envelope and recover the data.
  • A commitment means that data cannot be opened in two different ways. 

Why are commitments important? Commitments allow you to put data onto the blockchain which cannot be reversed because of the binding property, but the hiding property does not allow the data to be identified. 

The Merkle tree: a short proof of payment used in blockchain.


Succinct zero-knowledge proof systems

You wouldn't believe this is possible. The kindergarten explanation is: Imagine the “ finding Waldo game.” The zero-knowledge proof system is a way to prove where Waldo is. 

Imagine taking the scissors and cutting Waldo out, putting him aside and then ripping out the rest of the picture. This way nobody knows where Waldo is.



What is a proof system?

  • You have a Prover and a Verifier, and the prover wants to convince the verifier of a certain fact, a statement.
  • The Verifier can either accept or reject the fact that the Prover has a signature. 
  • If he verifies, he accepts that the Prover has a signature without knowing what the signature is. Therefore, he has “zero-knowledge” but knows it is there at the same time. 

Properties of a proof system

  • Complete: if statement is true, prover can convince verifier
  • Succinct proof: proof is short 
  • Fast verification: verification is fast 
  • Efficient proof generation: Quickly generating proof
  • =SNARK


Security

  • Sound: prover cannot convince verifier od false statement 
  • Zero-knowledge: verifier learns nothing about the witness
  • =zkSNARK 


What is Roll-up? 

Today every transaction needs to be verified by a miner, in the future the miners will just need to verify the proof. You can compress thousands of transactions into a “proof” which needs to be verified. This way the transaction speed will increase dramatically. 

Private data on a public blockchain - the future of blockchain

Today, data on blockchain is public. Businesses cannot use it for private B2B applications. In the future, you can have a secret code and apply zero-knowledge proof that the code is running correctly even though nobody knows what the code is and nobody knows what the data is.  So everything is verifiable but everything is hidden.



When to use a blockchain? 

Blockchain is not a database. Use it when there is no single party trusted by everyone. The downside: it’s slower and more complex than a centralized system.

Social Media and US Politics

The current US political landscape is unlike any other. Over the years, various forms of media have fanned the flames of polarization, but this is especially true for social media platforms. Social media has acted as a megaphone for less moderate groups to perpetuate ideas that are based on personal vested interests that may only benefit them, as opposed to promoting ideas that would benefit the majority. However, evidence has shown that the majority of Americans remain more moderate, rational, and reasonable; unfortunately, however, their voices tend to get drowned out. 

Unlike previous advances in connectivity (such as phone calls and emails), which brought us direct private interactions, social media has introduced hyperconnected, indirect, and public interactions (such as the like button and “retweet” feature). This has led to widespread intimidation tactics, dishonesty, the perpetuation of harmful conspiracy theories, and a state of constant ideological war. 

Seeing that social media platforms are increasingly becoming the new “public squares” wherein people discuss pressing issues and topics, Jonathan Haidt believes social media should install infrastructure to increase user accountability. Similar to how people are not allowed to go out into physical public squares and attack other people anonymously, social media users should not be allowed to open anonymous accounts and get away with attacking other users.


The 2020 US Elections: Trump versus Biden

Jonathan predicts that the 2020 elections could go either way for a number of factors. Despite the Trump administration’s mismanagement of the pandemic response, Biden himself is far from the perfect Democrat candidate. People tend to gravitate towards vigorous leaders, and Biden does not come across as one. 

At the same time, negative partisanship could play a key role in the upcoming election. Negative partisanship refers to the phenomenon where voting against something you don’t want is a more powerful motivator than voting for something you do want. Therefore, there is a high chance that even though people may not wholeheartedly support Biden, they would rather vote for him than reelect the Trump administration.

Regardless of political affiliations, the extreme polarization is standing in the way of pragmatic solutions and a better future for the country. Jonathan Haidt referenced Federalist No. 10, which warned how political polarization can distract a democratic society from working towards the common good. Jonathan also reminded listeners of a relevant John Stuart Mills quote: “He who only knows his own side of the case knows little of that.”

Therefore, all Americans need to work hard towards reducing the political polarization in order to come to an objective view of reality, and make decisions rooted in it. The pandemic has taught everyone that we all still have a lot to learn. 


Social Media and Young Minds

Since 2012, the rates for anxiety, depression, self-harm, and suicide among members of Generation Z (persons born after 1996) has been spiking upwards. While both genders have been affected, the depression and anxiety rates have been especially high among girls. 

Jonathan Haidt and Greg Lukianoff investigated why this was the case in their book, The Coddling of the American Mind. They uncovered several factors, but two of the biggest ones were:

  1. The growing trend of parental overprotectiveness: Most members of Generation Z spent significant portions of their childhoods playing indoors on electronic devices. This has led to increased anxiety and fragility when dealing with the outside world as compared to Generation Y (aka Millennials).
  2. Too early exposure to social media: Research has shown that social media impacts mental health negatively. There are certain things that young minds simply aren’t equipped to deal with yet, and social media is one of them.

Jonathan’s survey of middle schoolers found that social media increases their anxiety and self-consciousness as opposed to making them more secure or comfortable with who they are. This is why Jonathan is advocating for systemic (school-wide, even nationwide) changes that discourage parents from exposing their children to social media too early.

Jonathan is not against electronic devices and screens as long as they are used to facilitate direct interactions; the problem lies with the impact of the indirect interactions as mentioned in the first section.

Disclaimer: The information discussed by Dr. Rhonda Patrick is not meant to suggest that Vitamin C is an outright cure for COVID-19. There are numerous ongoing trials around the world to see if the intravenous (IV) administration could play a role in curing COVID-19, but there is no data confirming its effectiveness yet.


About Vitamin C

It is a well-known antioxidant that supports numerous physiological processes and protects macromolecules (proteins, carbohydrates, etc.). While most animals can synthesize their own Vitamin C, humans can only acquire it from food and supplements. 

It is important to remember that there is a world of difference between the effects of oral intake and IV intake of Vitamin C. After all, the IV administration of Vitamin C achieves a blood plasma concentration level that is 68 times higher than the maximum level that can be achieved with oral administration. 

Orally-administered Vitamin C is absorbed in the small intestine, while IV administration bypasses that process. Inside the liver, Vitamin C gets broken down into intermediate molecules and gets distributed throughout the body’s tissues.


The recommended dietary allowance (RDA) of Vitamin C

A person’s RDA depends on numerous factors, such as age, sex, life stage, and lifestyle. Pregnant women, people who regularly smoke or consume alcohol, or patients with certain medical conditions or who are undergoing certain treatments (such as dialysis), are examples of people with increased Vitamin C needs. These factors can also affect the absorption of Vitamin C. 

The average RDA of Vitamin C for adult men is 90 milligrams per day and 75 milligrams per day for women. But scientists believe there is enough evidence to increase the RDA for adults to 200 milligrams a day, and that doing so could potentially reduce their risk for chronic diseases.


The role of Vitamin C

Vitamin C boosts immune function by protecting immune cells and reducing the death of T-cells. There is evidence that the supplementation of Vitamin C can reduce the severity and duration of common cold symptoms.

Vitamin C has also proven effective in reducing the amount of time patients are kept on mechanical ventilation. It may even reduce pneumonia risk and also be protective against lung cancer. Vitamin C could hinder cancer cells from utilizing glucose for survival and growth while also interacting with the iron found in those cancer cells to produce hydrogen peroxide, which contributes to the death of cancer cells while leaving healthy cells undamaged.

Some epidemiological studies have linked endurance activities to a higher risk of upper respiratory infections; it is possible that Vitamin C (alone or when combined with Vitamin E) could positively/negatively impact the effects of endurance activities. Findings also suggest that Vitamin C can help with fat burning. 

From infancy up until old age, Vitamin C has also been shown to support brain function and decrease the risk of neurodegenerative diseases (such as Alzheimer’s, Parkinsons, etc.) by reducing brain oxidative damage. When Vitamin C supplements conventional treatment, it has been shown to be effective in treating myocarditis in children and sepsis.

When used as a supplement to chemotherapy, there is some evidence that Vitamin C can improve patients’ quality of life. And thanks to its antioxidant activity, Vitamin C might even play a role in increasing male fertility. Finally, for both oral and IV administration, Vitamin C has proven effective in lowering high blood pressure and reducing inflammation.


Side effects of Vitamin C

Clearly, Vitamin C is beneficial and generally safe. However, not abiding by the oral 2000 milligram upper intake daily limit could lead to gastrointestinal problems. Furthermore, people with high levels of iron in their blood should be careful with Vitamin C. 

IV administration of Vitamin C could lead to a wide variety of side effects (ranging in seriousness from nausea to the rupturing of red blood cells), especially in cancer patients.

While many are concerned that Vitamin C intake could lead to kidney stones, this is a low risk for healthy people. This may be more likely for patients with preexisting kidney impairments.

The second order effects of COVID-19

Emerson Spartz and some of his co-creators put out an article about the second order effects of the coronavirus pandemic. First order effects result directly from the pandemic, stay-at-home measures, for example. These in turn cause second order effects:since people are staying at home, perhaps the number of babies born will increase, or the number of divorces may go up, or the number of grocery deliveries will shoot up. With the current conditions, this provides a great opportunity for adaptation in businesses that may result in more drive-in or drive-through services, like movies, cafés, etc.

Thinking about these second order effects can help you prepare for the future, avoid certain seemingly-inevitable challenges and put you in the perfect position to take advantage of opportunities that are not yet clear to others. Mapping out these logical casualties can prove to be significantly helpful in identifying new and promising business opportunities for novice entrepreneurs. For example, camping and RV-ing may go up as people still want to travel but might not be willing to do so through usual methods (air, train, bus). Businesses and non-profits like Hipcamp and KOA that facilitate such travel will likely boom post-lockdown.

Although many of the habits and activities currently banned/avoided (handshaking, watching movies in the theatre, dance clubs, etc) may soon return into daily lives, they will still bear the marks of change they underwent during the pandemic. The crisis has pushed companies to rapidly adapt to remote working, and some may now find this mode to be cheaper, faster, more productive. As a result we can expect many companies to continue the remote-work culture even after the social distancing imposition is lifted.

He writes an annual letter where he states interesting business ideas: for example, vertical market softwares and stock-value-raising incentives for company executives. In this perspective, Vista Equity Partners and Trilogy Software are also interesting examples.

The fate of an entrepreneur’s aspirations

Young amateur entrepreneurs usually start off with the idea of doing something “cool” or “sexy”. But along their journey of understanding how businesses and markets work, they tend to trade away some of this creativity and settle for things that work and provide profit. However, keeping all the practicalities in mind, it can sometimes be rewarding to think about what you think is “cool” or “fun” and try to make it into a feasible business model. It’s important to achieve balance between prudence and excitement.

Group buying: the new way to get ultimate discounts and better advertisement

Pinduoduo is like Groupon, but with friends. For example, you can buy a $20 box of tissues for about $8 each if you buy it with other people. All you need to do is create a team, share the link to the product on your usual texting app with your friends, and if they’re in, you’re ready to group-buy! Other sites like MashDrop and Masterclass that have similar group-discounts seem to be quite successful. The reason group schemes work out for such businesses is that essentially they are paying (the discount to) a customer (the primary buyer) to bring them more customers - which is what they would have paid for other forms of advertising. Introduction to a product by friends also increases faith in the purchase of that product which is an added bonus. This scheme would most likely work for digital, high-value products.

Quick background on Cuban

Mark started his tech career selling PC software for a company in Dallas. With no prior knowledge of this field, he started teaching himself how to program on the job. Eventually, he was fired and used this opportunity to start his own company, MicroSolutions, which he sold to H&R Block a few years later. In 1995 he started the streaming company AudioNet, which later evolved into Broadcast.com. In 1999, this company was sold to Yahoo! at a whopping $5.7 billion. Shortly after that, he bought the Dallas Mavericks NBA team.

‍

His relationship with money and risk

Mark went from living as a broke student to becoming a billionaire. After selling Broadcast.com, it was not about the next dollar anymore, and he began to think about how he could help his family and the world by investing in small/medium businesses.

He also realized life was about having fun, so with the money he made from selling MicroSolutions, he bought a lifetime pass airline ticket and just traveled the world. Control of his time was the most important thing, so he always wanted to be rich enough to be free.

Mark hates risk and is terrified of it. He fondly remembers what his college basketball coach once said. “Everybody has the will to win but it's only those with the will to prepare for it who win”. He isn’t opposed to risk if he has done the homework for it. Understanding what he is getting into reduces his fear of it.

‍

Post-COVID-19 business advice

Mark believes that people quit when they either run out of money or run out of time. He urges entrepreneurs to be brutally honest with themselves to see why something is/is not happening. Everything is going to be crazy after the pandemic, making it the best time for entrepreneurs to come up with something new and different. Expect some world-class companies to be born.

Although the pandemic may not change the macroeconomics, previous trends that affected businesses negatively will have changed significantly. We can expect a push towards robotics, digital technology and AI. In fact, Mark himself has recently invested in five robotics-based companies.

Many people have the misconception that you need to be able to raise large amounts of money to run a business. Mark Cuban thinks you don’t. Most big businesses don’t raise money. Sweat equities are all you absolutely need. So if you have an idea, have lost your job, and/or are looking for a new direction, why not go big on our dreams now?

‍

How to think like Mark Cuban

Price sensitivity is key while investing in something. When Mark is buying something big on a passion play (like an NBA team), he cares less about the price. But in his other investments, he first looks at his upsides and leverage points. He prefers to make money from the cash-flow of the company rather than its exit, as he has more control on profitability.

The best investments are the ones that return cash. To Mark, investors from Silicon Valley are like old Hollywood, where everyone wanted to be an actor. No matter who you hire, they think it's a stepping stone to their own business or start-up because there are so many VCs today.

“Sales cures all. There’s never been a company in the history of companies that’s ever succeeded without sales.” – Mark Cuban

The most common mistake in sales is made in product evaluation, so price your product in relation to the value it provides customers. If it’s your baby and you’re afraid of rejection, you may end up underpricing your products. Remember you can always price higher then work your way down if needed.

Delegation is the key to accelerating your business. Entrepreneurs must first have a vision for their organization and figure out how to align others on it. The next step is finding managers you can trust. If you expect to accelerate things, you need managers to delegate. In the initial stages of a start-up, it’s important to hire slow and fire fast.
